Vehicle designed and constructed for the carriage of passengers and comprising no more than eight seats in addition to the driver's seat.

• the engine capacity is less than 50cm³
  • whatever the means of propulsion, the maximum design speed is less than 50km/h
  • for example an electric bicycle.

• the engine capacity is more than 50cm³; or
  • whatever the means of propulsion, the maximum design speed is over 50km/h
  • for example a motorcycle

• the engine capacity is less than 50cm³; and
  • whatever the means of propulsion, the maximum design speed is less than 50km/h
  • for example an auto rickshaw

• the engine capacity is more than 50cm³; or
  • whatever the means of propulsion, the maximum design speed is over 50 km/h
  • the three wheels are in an off-centre arrangement, like a motorcycle and sidecar

• the engine capacity is more than 50cm³; or
  • whatever the means of propulsion, the maximum design speed is over 50km/h
  • the three wheels are in a symmetrical arrangement, like a motorised tricycle

• the unladen mass is less than 350kg, not including the mass of the batteries in case of electric vehicles
  • the maximum design speed is less than 45km/h
  • the engine capacity is less than 50cm³ for spark (positive) ignition engines; or
  • the maximum net power output does not exceed 4kW in the case of other internal combustion engines; or
  • the maximum continuous rated power does not exceed 4kW in the case of electric engines
  • for example golf carts and mobility scooters

• the unladen mass is less than 400 kg (550 kg for vehicles intended for carrying goods), not including the mass of batteries in the case of electric vehicles; and
  • the maximum continuous rated power does not exceed 15 kW
  • for example microcars
